column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=3. Results and Discussion
#Text=3.1. Supervised Classification of Hyperspectral Pixels at the Ground Canopy Scale

#Text=One approach used to analyze hyperspectral data on the field scale is the pixel-wise classification into usual pixel ( background , straw , healthy leaf tissue ) and in disease specific symptoms .
#Text=In the field experiment 2018 , YR had a significant disease severity and classifiers for this disease were derived .
#Text=The use of 16 VIs reached a reasonable but not competitive performance .
#Text=However , it has to be noted that we compared 161 features to 16 , meaning a significant reduction in dimensionality .
#Text=The results can be integrated in a later discussion of the various feature sets obtained by feature selection .
#Text=Based on these results , SVM SNV ( Table 1 ) was selected as most appropriate approach .
#Text=A visual comparison of the SAM results and the SVM SNV result is shown in
#Text=Figure 5
#Text=.
#Text=Significant differences were apparent .
#Text=The SVM detected many more senescent leaves , e.g. , all leaves from the lower leaf levels , whereas the SAM assigned these to the background or the healthy leaves .
#Text=The SVM was more sensitive for ear detection , which caused major problems in the SAM image , where they were partly assigned to YR .

#Text=Overall , both approaches were sensitive to YR , but the SVM was much more accurate in the very bright image parts as well as the darker background parts , while the class YR was overrepresented in the SAM classification .
#Text=The visually most significant aspect was the large number of blue pixels in the visualization of the SVM result .
#Text=YR disease was present at all leaf levels and led to early senescence in lower leaf levels .

#Text=The classification models were validated via two approaches : ( 1 ) pixel-wise classification of the hold-out test data set consisting of manually annotated pixels of new images of separate plots , and ( 2 ) prediction of pixel classes of all images obtained on a respective day and comparing the total % disease class from all plant pixels to the visual assessment done by the expert (
#Text=Figure 6
#Text=) .

#Text=Approach 1 resulted in a confusion matrix allowing the calculation of multiple performance measures such as the overall accuracy , the sensitivity , and the recall , whereas Approach 2 provided the R²value , correlation coefficient , and a regression plot .
#Text=Table 1 shows the overall accuracy and the F1 score for the different classification methods .
#Text=Presumably , due to light reflections and transmission or a deviating weighting of the different canopy levels , the SVM prediction overestimated the ratio of diseased pixels .
#Text=To compensate for this , a linear regression model was applied .

#Text=However , deviations between the predicted disease severity and the visual assessment could have various reasons , e.g. , the section of the plot observed by the sensor did not represent the true status that was evaluated by the visual assessment .
#Text=The viewing angle produced a variable composition of different leafs and leaf layers in the field of view of the human and the sensors .

#Text=Furthermore , the visibility of the lower leaf levels was low for imaging system from the top , and more accurate if the human rater could go deep into the crop stand for individual leaf disease rating .
#Text=Further points are that the visual assessment produced a single value averaging the affected leaf area .
#Text=From repeated disease assessments with multiple experts , different deviations have been observed depending on the literature .
#Text=The method of disease detection is subjective to the individuals performing the assessment .
#Text=Another prime factor for deviations and classification inaccuracies is the biological heterogeneity .
#Text=This has to be considered as highly dynamic within one field , one plot , and one location , and even on different leaf layers and single leaves .

#Text=The biological heterogeneity can be affected by many factors , e.g. , the leaf color and status , stem elongation ( distance of leaf layers ) , the density of the canopy , and other biological growth processes .
#Text=3.2. Evaluation of Hyperspectral UAV Observations Using a Filter-System Hyperspectral Camera
#Text=To characterize the reflectance characteristics of the field plots , the spectra of the central 4 × 2 m of each plot were averaged .
#Text=Intra-plot variations were neglected .
#Text=Multiple traits were predicted with reasonable accuracy based on SVM and SVR analysis of the 55 recorded bands from 500 – 900 nm .
#Text=Table 2 shows the obtained performance parameters based on a SNV representation and the integration of all 55 bands .
#Text=Using the SVR approach , a prediction of the disease severity in percent was possible with reasonable accuracy (
#Text=Figure 7
#Text=) .

#Text=The interpretation of this result has to take into account that a value from the visual assessment might not represent the average plot value because diseases may occur at zoned locations in the plot , and assessment locations may or may not be in these spots .
